intro: Antholyza ludwigii, commonly known as the Ludwig's antholyza, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features slender, branching stems and produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
